org.apache.freemarker.core.templateresolver

Class TemplateLoadingResult

extends Object
    Return value of TemplateLoader.load(String, TemplateLoadingSource, Serializable, TemplateLoaderSession)

    • Constructor Detail

      • TemplateLoadingResult

        public TemplateLoadingResult(TemplateLoadingSource source,
                             Serializable version,
                             Reader reader,
                             TemplateConfiguration templateConfiguration)
        Creates an instance with status TemplateLoadingResultStatus.OPENED, for a storage mechanism that naturally returns the template content as sequence of char-s as opposed to a sequence of byte-s. This is the case for example when you store the template in a database in a varchar or CLOB. Do not use this constructor for stores that naturally return binary data instead (like files, class loader resources, BLOB-s, etc.), because using this constructor will disable FreeMarker's charset selection mechanism.
        Parameters:
        source - See getSource()
        version - See getVersion() for the meaning of this. Can be null, but use that only if the backing storage mechanism doesn't know this information.
        reader - Gives the content of the template. It will be read in few thousand character chunks by FreeMarker, so generally it need not be a BufferedReader.
        templateConfiguration - Usually null, as usually the backing storage mechanism doesn't store such information; see getTemplateConfiguration().

      • TemplateLoadingResult

        public TemplateLoadingResult(TemplateLoadingSource source,
                             Serializable version,
                             InputStream inputStream,
                             TemplateConfiguration templateConfiguration)
        Creates an instance with status TemplateLoadingResultStatus.OPENED, for a storage mechanism that naturally returns the template content as sequence of byte-s as opposed to a sequence of char-s. This is the case for example when you store the template in a file, classpath resource, or BLOB. Do not use this constructor for stores that naturally return text instead (like database varchar and CLOB columns).
        Parameters:
        source - See getSource()
        version - See getVersion() for the meaning of this. Can be null, but use that only if the backing storage mechanism doesn't know this information.
        inputStream - Gives the content of the template. It will be read in few thousand byte chunks by FreeMarker, so generally it need not be a BufferedInputStream.
        templateConfiguration - Usually null, as usually the backing storage mechanism doesn't store such information; see getTemplateConfiguration(). The most probable application is supplying the charset (encoding) used by the InputStream (via MutableParsingAndProcessingConfiguration.setSourceEncoding(Charset)), but only do that if the storage mechanism really knows what the charset is.

    • Method Detail

      • getInputStream

        public InputStream getInputStream()
        Returns non-null exactly if getStatus() is TemplateLoadingResultStatus.OPENED and the backing store mechanism returns content as byte-s, as opposed to as chars-s. See also TemplateLoadingResult(TemplateLoadingSource, Serializable, InputStream, TemplateConfiguration). It's the responsibility of the caller (which is DefaultTemplateResolver usually) to close() the InputStream. The return value is always the same instance, no mater when and how many times this method is called.

        The returned InputStream will be read in few kilobyte chunks by FreeMarker, so generally it need not be a BufferedInputStream.

        Returns:
        null or a InputStream to read the template content; see method description for more.

      • getStatus

        public TemplateLoadingResultStatus getStatus()
        Tells what kind of result this is; see the documentation of TemplateLoadingResultStatus.

      • getSource

        public TemplateLoadingSource getSource()
        Identifies the source on the level of the storage mechanism; stored in the cache together with the version (getVersion()). When checking if a cache entry is up to date, the sources are compared, and only if they are equal are the versions compared. See more at TemplateLoadingSource.

      • getVersion

        public Serializable getVersion()
        If the result status is TemplateLoadingResultStatus.OPENED and the backing storage stores such information, the version (usually the last modification time) of the loaded template, otherwise null. The version is some kind of value which changes when the template in the backing storage is updated. Usually, it's the last modification time (a Date or Long), though that can be problematic if the template can change twice within the granularity of the clock used by the storage. Thus some storages may use a revision number instead that's always increased when the template is updated, or the cryptographic hash of the template content as the version. Version objects are compared with each other with their Object.equals(Object) method, to see if a cache entry is outdated (though only when the source objects (getSource()) are equal). Thus, the version object must have proper Object.equals(Object) and Object.hashCode() methods.

      • getReader

        public Reader getReader()
        Returns non-null exactly if getStatus() is TemplateLoadingResultStatus.OPENED and the backing store mechanism returns content as char-s, as opposed to as byte-s. See also TemplateLoadingResult(TemplateLoadingSource, Serializable, Reader, TemplateConfiguration). It's the responsibility of the caller (which is DefaultTemplateResolver usually) to close() the Reader. The return value is always the same instance, no mater when and how many times this method is called.

        The returned Reader will be read in few thousand character chunks by FreeMarker, so generally it need not be a BufferedReader.

        Returns:
        null or a Reader to read the template content; see method description for more.

      • getTemplateConfiguration

        public TemplateConfiguration getTemplateConfiguration()
        If getStatus() is TemplateLoadingResultStatus.OPENED, and the template loader stores such information (which is rare) then it returns the TemplateConfiguration applicable to the template, otherwise it returns null. If getStatus() is not TemplateLoadingResultStatus.OPENED, then this should always return null. If there are TemplateConfiguration-s coming from other sources, such as from Configuration.getTemplateConfigurations(), this won't replace them, but will be merged with them, with properties coming from the returned TemplateConfiguration having the highest priority.
        Returns:
        null, or a TemplateConfiguration.
